wikipedia_page.main:
Garry Edwin Jones (11 December 1950 – 6 April 2016) was an English footballer who played as a centre forward.
In 1965, at the age of 15, he was known locally for playing for the Manchester schoolboys.Spending most of his career (1968–1975) at Bolton Wanderers, playing 236 games and scoring 55 goals, he also had spells at Sheffield United, Los Angeles Aztecs, Blackpool, Hereford United, and Runcorn.On 5 October 1971, he scored all three goals in Bolton's victory over Manchester City in the League Cup.
